answers.answer: Hello,Flushing of the face may  be associated with certain medical conditions like:-Alcohol use / induced liver problems- hyperthyroidism or adrenal gland diseases-Carcinoid syndrome-Certain medicines used to treat diabetes and high cholesterol-Extreme emotions-MenopauseGod blessBob Hilton

question: My husband has experienced 2 times this last two months symptoms of a severe flush starting at his face and traveling down his body, accompanied by weakness and tingling in his legs and shaking which may have been nerves.  He has not passed out but feels very close too.  We went to the e-room both times this has happened.  He had clear EKG, CVC/?, Metabolic rate test and blood count tests.  He is on no medication and has no prior history.  My sister experienced migrains that she did not feel pain with but made her pass out, could this be simular? He is 160 pounds 6'1, athletic, 28 years old.
title: Could this be a type of Migrane? Cardio, Thyroid?
